maintext.text:
Commander,
Dr. Muller is trying to reach you on the communicator.

There seem to be difficulties.

I will establish a connection to the diving shuttle.

leftButton.lbText: Yes, hurry up!

rightButton.rbText:
Of course!
Somehow I was expecting something like this. What exactly is going on?

maintext.text:
Come in, Commander.

I'm having a problem here.

The navigational computer is going haywire, the positional data I'm getting just can't be right...

At least, I think so.

leftButton.lbText: What does that mean?

rightButton.rbText: Didn't you check the navigational computer before taking off?

maintext.text:
I did, actually.

I have no explanation for this.
The systems were all working perfectly.

I really don't understand why we're having problems again.

leftButton.lbText: Calm down, Robin. What exactly is malfunctioning?

rightButton.rbText:
Pull yourself together and focus!
Tell me exactly what's going on.

maintext.text:
Well...
the system seems somehow corrupted.
The computer isn't displaying my location anymore.
And I am only getting incomplete coordinates for the dig site.

What should I do?

leftButton.lbText:
Can you see something outside? Maybe navigate by sight?
You already know the way.

rightButton.rbText: Shut down the system and restart the navigational computer.

maintext.text:
Okay, I'm restarting the systems now.

The navigational computer is booting...
…
…
System back online.
...Damn it. That didn't work. The displays are still all wrong.

leftButton.lbText: Then I guess your only choice is to navigate by sight.

rightButton.rbText:
Weird.
That always works for my computer.

How's the visibility?.

maintext.text:
Visibility is extremely bad.
With the shuttle's headlights I can only see about 10 meters ahead.
There's rocks and debris everywhere.

The autopilot is still steering the shuttle, but I think we're going the wrong way.

leftButton.lbText: Switch to manual operation. I'll help you navigate.

rightButton.rbText:
You need to take over control of the shuttle, Robin.
C.U.R.E. will help you navigate.

maintext.text:
Commander, I would strongly advise against deactivating the autopilot.

The odds that Dr. Muller will be able to safely operate the shuttle in these conditions are 47 to 1.

leftButton.lbText: Thanks for the advice. We'll do it anyway.

rightButton.rbText:
Don't tell me her odds.
Just help us get her safely to our target.

maintext.text:
Commander,
if you act against my explicit advice, you have to authorize your decision with the override code, and I am required to inform mission control.

leftButton.lbText:
My decision is final.

Override code:
"DELTA 7"

rightButton.rbText:
Listen up you glorified tin can! Here's my override code:
DO WHAT I TELL YOU RIGHT NOW

maintext.text:
…
…
…
Affirmative, Commander.

Confirming:
Deactivation of the autopilot

Protocolling:
Ignored recommendation

leftButton.lbText:
Robin,
did you hear that?
You can now switch to manual controls.

rightButton.rbText:
See,
that wasn't so hard, was it?

maintext.text:
Commander,
the autopilot is deactivated.

I am piloting the shuttle by hand.

There's only some weak currents down here, it shouldn't be too hard to compensate for them.

leftButton.lbText: Okay, tell me what you're seeing and give me a status report.

rightButton.rbText: Transmit your current coordinates to C.U.R.E.

maintext.text:
I am currently travelling at two knots.
Depth, 2300 meters.
Height above ground is 3 meters.

Right in front of me I see the beginning of a gorge or some kind of trench.
I am unable to judge how deep down it goes.
The currents seem to get stronger there.

leftButton.lbText:
Understood.
Keep to the right of the trench.

rightButton.rbText:
Okay.
Pass the trench on the left side.

maintext.text:
Correcting to the right...

Damn it!

The controls are barely responding.

I am caught in a strong current.

What should I do?

leftButton.lbText:
Full thrust reverse!
Quick!

rightButton.rbText:
Full thrust ahead!
Try to escape upwards!

maintext.text:
Correcting to the left...

Damn it!

The controls are barely responding.

I am caught in a strong current.

What should I do?

leftButton.lbText:
Full thrust reverse!
Quick!

rightButton.rbText:
Full thrust ahead!
Try to escape upwards!

maintext.text:
Ok, thrusters on full!

The stabilizers are in the red.
Hull integrity at 70 percent.

It's not working!

The current is too strong.
I'm being pulled into the trench!

leftButton.lbText:
Hang in there!
I'll think of something.

rightButton.rbText:
C.U.R.E.
what's happening there?
Help her out!

maintext.text:
Commander,
my data indicates that the trench is much deeper than the shuttle's maximum diving depth.

If Dr. Muller is pulled into it, the pressure will destroy the shuttle.

leftButton.lbText:
Damn it!
How deep down does it go, C.U.R.E.?

rightButton.rbText:
That's not helping.
I need a suggestion on how to get Robin out of there.

maintext.text:
Calculating...
...
...
Evaluation not possible.

My information on the trench is incomplete, I am unable to calculate the depth due to missing topographical data.

leftButton.lbText:
Just great.
You're completely useless right now, C.U.R.E.

rightButton.rbText:
Okay,
let's just assume the trench is goddamn deep.

maintext.text:
Affirmative, Commander.

Calculating possible scenarios.
…
…
Calculating...
…
…
Calculating...

leftButton.lbText:
How long is this gonna take?
I thought you're a supercomputer!

rightButton.rbText:
Just great.
You're completely useless right now, C.U.R.E.

maintext.text:
Commander,
it's not looking good.

The outside pressure is climbing too high!
Hull integrity is at 40 percent now.

And I still haven't regained control of the shuttle.

leftButton.lbText: I have an idea, but it's risky and I don't know if it's going to work.

rightButton.rbText:
[lie]
We've made some calculations and figured out how to get you safely out of there.

maintext.text:
I have no choice.
I'm getting pulled deeper and deeper into the trench.

The hull won't be able to take this for long.

Out with it, what's the plan?

leftButton.lbText:
You need to find a way to overload the oxygen tanks.
The resulting explosion should launch you out of the current.

rightButton.rbText: A precisely calculated overload of the oxygen tanks would trigger a controlled explosion, which will propel you out of the current.

maintext.text:
Commander,
I must strongly advise against this plan.

Dr. Muller would not have enough oxygen left to make it back to the station.

leftButton.lbText: If we don't do it the shuttle will be destroyed and she will die down there.

rightButton.rbText:
Do you need my override code again?
I thought we were through with that?

maintext.text:
Commander,
I cannot support decisions with consequences of this magnitude.
The odds of Dr. Muller surviving such a maneuver are appr...

We're out of time!
I'll do it.
I will reroute the fuel line into one of the oxygen tanks until the pressure triggers an explosion.

C.U.R.E., you need to help me override the security protocols.

leftButton.lbText: Do it, C.U.R.E. I'll take full responsibility. Permission granted.

rightButton.rbText: C.U.R.E., override the security protocols of the diving shuttle. Permission granted.

maintext.text:
Understood, Commander.

Overriding security protocols

Deactivating life support systems...

Finished.

leftButton.lbText:
Just the security protocols!
Not life support, C.U.R.E.!

rightButton.rbText:
Well done.
Robin, did it work?

maintext.text:
Commander,
the life support systems are connected to the security protocols for emergency override, which interface between the fuel reserves and oxygen tanks.
You should have known that.

leftButton.lbText:
[lie]
Ah yes, of course.
I knew that.

rightButton.rbText:
You should have told me earlier!
Robin,
is everything all right?

maintext.text:
The pressure in one of the oxygen tanks is rising.

110 percent
120 percent
150 percent
we're already at over 200 per...
…
...

leftButton.lbText: Robin?!

rightButton.rbText: Damn it!

maintext.text: ***offline***

leftButton.lbText:
Robin?!
Are you still there?

rightButton.rbText:
C.U.R.E.?
What happened?

maintext.text:
Commander,
the overload of the oxygen tanks caused an explosion.
Unfortunately, the resulting chain reaction destroyed the second oxygen tank as well.
My radar is not picking up the shuttle anymore.

leftButton.lbText: Why didn't you warn me that this could happen?

rightButton.rbText:
Oh no.
Search everything, we need to find robin.

maintext.text:
I did that, Commander.

I have expressed my concerns about this course of action.

But you ignored my warnings.

leftButton.lbText:
Yeah, yeah. All right.

Search the perimeter now.
We need to find her.

rightButton.rbText: You were right. Please stop me from making more bad decisions in the future. Now search the perimeter.

maintext.text:
Scanning...
…
…
Scanning...
…
…
Scanning...
…
...

leftButton.lbText:
How much longer is it gonna take?
Where's the shuttle?

rightButton.rbText: Did you find anything yet?

maintext.text:
Commander,
my scans could not yet locate the diving shuttle and Dr. Muller.

I will expand the search perimiter and contact you as soon as I have found something.

leftButton.lbText:
Understood.

Over and Out.

maintext.text: ***offline***

leftButton.lbText: [wait]

maintext.text:
Commander,

unfortunately, I have not yet been able to locate the diving shuttle and Dr. Muller.

I will expand the search perimiter and contact you as soon as I have found something.

leftButton.lbText: [wait]
